title: "Currently most champions are tied into one position."

embed.description: Gameplay Lead Producer Safelocked talks about the team's goals for early 2018. League of Legends Editorial Blog: http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/

body:
I'm both surprised and confused by this statement.

Historically, Riot has been extremely aggressive about nerfing champions who seek new lanes or jungle.

Alistar jungle, Lulu top, Karma mid/top have all been nerfed out of the stratosphere. The nerfs were deliberate and drastic. 

Does this mean these champs are going to be reworked, or their nerfs undone?

replies.body:
Yeah, I can understand how that seems a little confusing. 

When a new playstyle emerges our goal is never to shut it down immediately, but rather evaluate and see if it's healthy for the game. Over time, that means that we've nerfed some unhealthy playstyles rather than trying to find a way to make them healthier. 

The difference now, I think, is that we're actively seeking out more opportunities for champions to branch out into other positions, and see if we can support those more. So we're prioritizing those opportunities with the goal of opening up some healthy alternative playstyles.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Calad,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EmtKB4LN,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-01-23T20:04:34.128+0000)
>
> Yeah, I can understand how that seems a little confusing. 
> 
> When a new playstyle emerges our goal is never to shut it down immediately, but rather evaluate and see if it's healthy for the game. Over time, that means that we've nerfed some unhealthy playstyles rather than trying to find a way to make them healthier. 
> 
> The difference now, I think, is that we're actively seeking out more opportunities for champions to branch out into other positions, and see if we can support those more. So we're prioritizing those opportunities with the goal of opening up some healthy alternative playstyles.


*slides 25 cents at you because I'm broke as hell*

*Whispers* AP Miss Fortune...

On a more related note, its nice that you guys at Riot are looking at opportunities for more champions to go to other lanes than usual, as long as its healthy, just like you said. 

I know you guys have plans to make marksmen feel less mandatory, but can you say or at least hint at any ways you guys plan to do this?

I would love to see some old champs get some of their AP scalings back.  Aptroxx and AP Cait players have been crying along with a whole host of other champs.  Seeing some added support on other champs would be nice too.  

Things like dropping Vi's burst but making her W scale a bit harder with AD while giving Q an AP ratio would let Vi players choose between going for a bursty AP route, tanking up and relying on the % health for damage, or going for sustained damage by building AD.  It would preserve current playstyles while opening up new ones too.

Hopefully Riot adds in some more support for champs that want to build AP/AD but don't normally do so while trying to help champs branch out to other lanes.

> The difference now, I think, is that we're actively seeking out more opportunities for champions to branch out into other positions, and see if we can support those more. So we're prioritizing those opportunities with the goal of opening up some healthy alternative playstyles.

Instead of riot crafting playstyles for us to try out, could we be the ones experimenting with things? It would be much cooler if you could support emergent gameplay instead of designing it for us.

Yes, of course! Sorry, I did not mean to sound like the rito designers go into their secret lair and come up with playstyles on their own. If players discover a new cool playstyle, I think we'd try hard to find a way to support it in a healthy way. 

Go forth and innovate!

waha will be healthier, taric jungle or taric top? I kinda manage to make taric work as a sololaner in 3v3 (kinda like braum/tham) but I feel like his kit could work in the jungle too with some monster interaction

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Calad,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EmtKB4LN,comment-id=000500090001,timestamp=2018-01-24T16:00:11.555+0000)
>
> Yes, of course! Sorry, I did not mean to sound like the rito designers go into their secret lair and come up with playstyles on their own. If players discover a new cool playstyle, I think we'd try hard to find a way to support it in a healthy way. 
> 
> Go forth and innovate!

I'll believe it when I see it.
Nidalee Jungle.
Not exactly recent ....

[I haven't seen much of this in the past several years,](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/qVAaT1n4-this-patch-was-hilariously-dissapointing?comment=000d0008) so if this represents a new direction you're taking then i'm all for it. Good luck.
Nearly every time that happens, Riot doesn't approve of where the direction was heading and cuts it out at the knees.
Define "unhealthy". Unfun to play against?

"Unhealthy" as in little to no interaction and/or counterplay, which fits all the examples OP gave maybe with the exception of Karma mid. 

Alistar jungle essentially had access to a Malphite ult at level 2 for ganks, easy tower dives at level 6, and a pretty nice jungle* (not wave myb) clear so there wasn't much to gate him.
Lulu top became the new Renekton bar with the only real trade off (that I can think of) being that she shifted to utility late game, which wasn't too bad considering how abusive she was to the enemy laner.
Karma top was the same as Lulu except not as bad.

No one would mind any of those being viable options as long as they don't return as oppressive as they were when they first became popular.

(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VMAAfm095tg)

Meddler totally talked about this last year, thought it'd be a useful post to share as a refresher on what Riot has talked about in terms of 'healthy' alternate roles.
Thanks for the plug! This is definitely a good reference for people looking to understand more about how we evaluate whether a playstyle is healthy.

As a general rule, I never trust anything Meddler says.  He's told the playerbase too many bold-faced lies for me to believe anything he says anymore and thus far, I've not been disappointed.  Rather, whenever I hear Meddler say something, I automatically assume that the complete opposite is true and it has been each time.

He claimed Sona was "fine & doesn't need changes" a week before they announced her 2nd rework.  He claimed he wasn't nerfing Zyra & she'd be viable in mid, now she feels terrible and is still just as NOT viable mid as before.  This isn't me being paranoid, it's me noticing a straight-up PATTERN of behavior.

ok man, that's your choice, and I don't remember enough about what he said about Sona, but Zyra became MORE viable mid, even if the changes they made didn't quite get her there for a majority of players.

They're human beings and they're trying their best, my experience from reading Meddler's Quick Gameplay Thoughts the game tends to follow the direction he lays out in those. I think maybe you are really attached to your champs and maybe have expectations about what Meddler says about them, and when they don't meet your expectations you just assume he was lying instead of doing things in a way that's different than how you would do it. Just a thought.

Speaking of those "Quick Gameplay Thoughts," Meddler intentionally cherry-picks which inquiries he responds to every single time.  He only responds to easy questions, ignores any real issues.  Go ahead and check for yourself, in any given thread, there can be as many as a dozen separate players asking what's up with Sona.  He has never responded to a single one.  Meddler is most certainly one of the most-biased Ritoers I've seen thus far.

Ok, so I would refer you to take a look at the red tracker and see Rioters talk about why/when they respond to stuff, and what they don't respond to. Meddler tends to follow those rules as well.

If you don't feel like sorting through that, what I've gleaned is this: posts that make statements like 'the majority of players feel' or 'X champion is trash, fix them' or other such hyperbole are unlikely to get a response. Also, showing you know the gameplay patterns and strengths/weaknesses of the champion you're asking about and giving a well-reasoned post about them is likely to get a response.

Also, asking questions that the rioter in question is in a position to know things about helps. In the case of Meddler and Sona, you could ask him if there are planned changes (she actually just got a Q buff which is pretty relevant), if there aren't, and even asking if he knows which Rioter/thread/post you can go to for your best chance at an answer that is more in-depth could work. (my impression is that Meddler knows a lot of general direction-type questions, but specifics are better addressed to the teams working on them directly).

Ok, so I would refer you to take a look at the red tracker and see the Ritoers spend more time making excuses for actively choosing to not respond, than they do actually responding.  If they put as much effort into actually trying to discuss the game as they do fabricating excuses for not doing so, we wouldn't be complaining about them not discussing the game.

Furthermore, notice that most of those excuses are purely hypocritical, Rito typically commits the same accusations they make for not acknowledging our complaints, usually even in the same breath.  Then they make a blatantly sarcastic and disrespectful remark to deflect the situation away from themselves.  It's the same song and dance every time, I don't understand why even this sheeple League community allows themselves to fall prey to it repeatedly.

clearly you're pretty angry about this, I would really look at the things Rioters say they respond to. Following those rules I have gotten responses, and it's not guaranteed every time, but if you keep your cool and stay respectful you WILL get your answer. If you want to stay angry, by all means, but I would really recommend trying some of that out instead of just saying 'they never answer', bc that is objectively not true.

I'm not sure if this is the right place to post this to get some visibility, but I think these changes could be an opportunity to open up the jungle better to {{champion:133}} . Quinn right now has the problem of, when she is picked, she takes the place of what is usually a tank. Allowing her to have a faster clear in the jungle would help with this issue, letting her be picked while the top laner still picks someone more durable. This also would be good for game health, getting a frustrating champion into a less frustrating role. Even her ult and vision makes more sense in the jungle, allowing for more pressure across the entire map and safety of vision.

Currently Quinn can jungle, but it is weaker and more risky then most other junglers due to the kiting she requires and her slower clear speed. My proposed change is to add some additional damage to monsters onto her passive. This would reward her for making proper use of her passive in the jungle, rewarding her for kiting the monster properly, while keeping her damage to champions the same. 

Please. I've been through enough abuse for picking her over a tank. Please help open another option for us Quinn players, at least until she someday gets reworked.

#MissYaVal

{{champion:133}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:133}}
*is sneakily playing Morgana top lane*
can you sparkle some magic on the keystone tree and make a bruiser keystone for us please?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Calad,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EmtKB4LN,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-01-23T20:04:34.128+0000)
>
> Yeah, I can understand how that seems a little confusing. 
> 
> When a new playstyle emerges our goal is never to shut it down immediately, but rather evaluate and see if it's healthy for the game. Over time, that means that we've nerfed some unhealthy playstyles rather than trying to find a way to make them healthier. 
> 
> The difference now, I think, is that we're actively seeking out more opportunities for champions to branch out into other positions, and see if we can support those more. So we're prioritizing those opportunities with the goal of opening up some healthy alternative playstyles.

If talon's passive worked on larger jungle monsters he'd be a good jungler.

Why not balance the thing that makes the gameplay unhealthy? Take AP Kog'Maw mid for example. No effort was made to balance him mid because it wasn't his original "protect the Kog'Maw" role anymore. RECENTLY (a year ago actually) his E and R were nerfed because Meddler doesn't like playing VS Kog'Maw mid. Instead of changing why not learn how to play vs certain things. I have to learn how to play vs grotesquely overpowered, UNHEALTHY botlane ADCs every patch.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Calad,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EmtKB4LN,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-01-23T20:04:34.128+0000)
>
> Yeah, I can understand how that seems a little confusing. 
> 
> When a new playstyle emerges our goal is never to shut it down immediately, but rather evaluate and see if it's healthy for the game. Over time, that means that we've nerfed some unhealthy playstyles rather than trying to find a way to make them healthier. 
> 
> The difference now, I think, is that we're actively seeking out more opportunities for champions to branch out into other positions, and see if we can support those more. So we're prioritizing those opportunities with the goal of opening up some healthy alternative playstyles.

Unfortunately you guys seem like a bunch of hypocrites now for saying specific champions like Karma and Lulu were not allowed to be in solo lanes. instead of actually doing work, you know something you seem to only want to do with specific champions, you made these two champions very bland and ruined Karma's identity. Karma was first and foremost a mage with interactive abilities on allies. Since Karma's disaster of a VGU many years ago, you continued to take more abilities from Karma's kit to solidify her as nothing but a bland shield bot that builds shield enhancing items, to be somewhat relevant in the game mid to late game. What skill expression, fun and solo lane presence Karma had before her VGU was taken away and you continued to take more away from her as the years continued.

What can any part of the Development team and you tell me now and promise to do that, you haven't already said and haven't done for the past 5 years? No one cares. No one listens. No one wants to do actual work on your team. Stop kidding yourself if you want to sit here and say, **_"The difference now, I think, is that we're actively seeking out more opportunities for champions to branch out into other positions, and see if we can support those more. So we're prioritizing those opportunities with the goal of opening up some healthy alternative playstyles."_** Stop kidding yourself. If you actually took the time listen to feedback and the dedication form players who ACTUALLY play these champions and not when they are abused because of some shield enhancing item, you would know what we really want.

Karma - Bring back the shield bomb you removed from her and gave to Ivern. Bring back the mage identity that made her more interesting to play and didn't solidify her role as a shield bot support.

Lulu - If the problem with solo lane Lulu was her damage with her insane utility, why did you just nerf the damage and bottleneck her as a support? If a champion has too much of something in their kit it outshines them and really doesn't bring the champion's potential to the forefront. This is especially the case with Lulu since a lot of people enjoyed playing her in the top lane and mid, but you completely took that away because you wanted her to remain as a support.

------------------

What can you tell me right now that is going to reassure me you are going to look and actually WORK on champions like Lulu and Karma? I'll tell you what you are going to do: Work on ways to make Ezreal be able to jungle, go mid and play as ADC. OH WAIT! He can already do that and it has yet to be looked at or addressed. Great job.

Except Lulu and Karma in solo lane are totally not interactive for top lane enemies. You can't reach them because of their W, you can't poke them since you are melee, you just hug tower and can't even get ganks cause they will disengage with slows, CC, and speed-ups, and then eventually they will proceed to buff up your kogmaw that you didnt shutdown because u werent allowed to leave lane without losing your turret. GG WP.

> [{quoted}](name=Kata is horny,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EmtKB4LN,comment-id=0005000c0000,timestamp=2018-01-24T09:01:03.529+0000)
>

You can't reach them because of their W, you can't poke them since you are melee, you just hug tower and can't even get ganks cause they will disengage with slows, CC, and speed-ups, and then eventually they will proceed to buff up your kogmaw that you didnt shutdown because u werent allowed to leave lane without losing your turret. GG WP.

Ok then. If that is a problem why don't they fix that part of their kit? The issue is they didn't want to do anything but force them into the botlane as a support. They have an excuse but not a reason for doing it. They are just lazy.
The problem is that picks like Lulu mid or Fizz top only worked because they were overpowered

As a support {{champion:61}} main I'm happy to see Riot taking this direction.

I personally think her kit is already good support, all she is missing is a better manapool to be reliable on the role.
I second this. She gets OOM af as support but besides that she could be viable.

Glad to see someone who shares the same feeling
She's has potential, her kit is unique and fun. 
We could be easily enable her as a enchanter supp and have this playstyle which supports through the Ball usage. It feels like a new champion. Its so much different to use her kit offensively and to use it solely for defense and utility purposes! 
Most ADCs think I am a troll that will build like any Velkoz/Luz/Zyra Support

Ahh, so you're one of those that would call me out to switch supports becuz you dont know better.
Those dont have a long distance shield with Armor and MR, dont have a pseudo ward in their kit for bush control, they cant manipulate the flow of a match aswell (except for Karma). She pairs really well with imobile ADs:  Ashe, Jhin, Cait, Sivir; dashless champs such as Shyvana, Yi, Olaf, Teemo, GP, the new Swain; synergises specially well with Vayne and Yasuo.

> [{quoted}](name=Infernal Ironic,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EmtKB4LN,comment-id=000a00010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-24T21:04:05.433+0000)

 I understand you, also all Ori supps I ever saw went AP and that makes me look bad.
Makes me sad. I'd just love to show everyone how good she can be if played right
Let's not buff lulu

when a champion plays into a new lane riot doesn't nerf it immediatly

However when the new playstyle is unhealthy as fuck then yes they do and make it unviable

Alistar jungle was:
aids
cancer
overpowered as fuck
unbalanceable

his ganks had no counterplay, his clearing was fine, and there were no reasons to pick an other jungler into him
after he hit lvl 2 he could walk everywhere and get free kills everywhere without the enemy able to do anything

after lvl 6, if you cc'ed him he could remove the cc walk to you for a kill, and even towerdive

Nothing better than chilling at your tower seemingly safe.   Then a wild bull appears running at you, pulverize, and headbutts you a million miles away from your turret, while taking no damage from the tower.

> his ganks had no counterplay, his clearing was fine, and there were no reasons to pick an other jungler into him

Dude, is not like sup alistar can't roam and do the same thing

which is healthier because you know when he's roaming and when he 's not

when he's in the jungle he's missing 24/7

also support alistar can hardly gank top
and support alistar roaming means the adc is 1v2

edit: you can downvote me as much as you can but it doesn't change the fact that it's healthier, if it isn't feel free to tell me where my arguments were wrong
brand was designed as  amid laner, so was heimer so i dont know why they are on there. If anything brand support is the off role and top heimer is the off role.
I'm p sure Diana was also intended to be a jungler

Guess who hasn't been touched ?
Vayne top
Lucian mid
Twitch jungle

I wonder to which class do they belong to...
